intro: Hjaltalinia, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cold, harsh environments. Hjaltalinia has small, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to minimize water loss in its arctic habitat. It plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native ecosystems.
